page.title: 14RELIGION
page.content: The competition between the two Clipston Churches has been resolved over the years, the two rectors now preach in each others' church. A church has existed on the site of All Saints Church since the eleventh century. It was entirely rebuilt in the thirteenth century, and the south aisle was added at a later date. In 1886-88 the whole church was restored. At this time the two galleries on the south side of the nave, one above the other, were removed. The church possesses two fonts, one by the south door, the other by the north door. The one near the south door is used at present. A clock was placed in the tower to commemorate the Jubilee of Queen Victoria in 1887.
